intro: Rauvolfia rosea, commonly known as the rose of Jericho, is a succulent plant native to arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, branching stems and small, waxy leaves. The plant is known for its ability to survive extreme drought conditions by curling its leaves into a tight rosette. It produces small, white or pink flowers and is often used in traditional medicine. Its unique survival mechanisms make it an interesting subject in botanical studies.
